She turned her head to Agatha from where she lay on her back and watched as she shifted cautiously over to rest just the tips of her fingers against Rio’s hip. The usually confident, almost aggressively so, woman beside her looked once again tired, and cautious.

Rio shifted a little, trying to move slightly closer. “I won’t break if you touch me.”

“You’ve been through enough. I don’t want to hurt you more in the night.”

“Agatha, please.”

Rio reached then across to Agatha and winced as she did so, making Agatha frown more deeply and gently roll Rio back over, “Fine.”

Rio smiled triumphantly as she felt Agatha’s arm drape across her middle and the warmth of her body press in against her good side.

“See? Not hurting me.”

“It’s not funny,” Agatha said quickly, anticipating the laugh that threatened to spill from Rio’s lips.

“It can be,” Rio offered softly, her lips twitching just slightly as she felt Agatha’s hand work its way to her opposite hip and press a little more into her left side.

But Agatha ignored this, clearly still not at all finding it funny and Rio instead sighed and focused then on repeating her breathing to make sure she wasn’t disturbing her aching ribs too much.

She let the evening wash over her then, the pull of sleep too strong to fight much against it. It was just as she was drifting off, in that liminal space between sleeping and waking, that she heard Agatha speak again, barely above a whisper.

“I love you.”

If Agatha’s lips hadn’t been just pressed to her clavicle she wouldn’t have even believed that she heard her. But her breath against her skin was warm and Rio shivered slightly at the feel of it; the physical manifestation of Agatha’s earlier admission.

She fell asleep not long after that, warm in Agatha’s embrace and comforted by the knowledge that Agatha still felt the same, even if it was just a whisper against her skin.

Also Alice got off very lightly in this but she’s still in BIG TROUBLE

The Green Witch

Chapter Summary

In which we take more steps towards some new idea of happiness

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

As the sun streamed through the light curtains of the bedroom in apartment 7, it settled on two bodies entwined together, one long and straight, the other curled and protective.

Rio had fallen asleep almost immediately the previous night. Industrial strength pain meds as well as a general exhaustion pulling her into a deep but restless sleep. Agatha, sans pain meds but with extra exhaustion, had barely slept at all.

Too conscious of hurting Rio, too aware of the woman beside her, and too frightened to let herself drift off, she’d mostly lay still, allowing the sounds of Rio’s steady breathing to at least calm her still burning anger.

It was mid-morning now, and Rio hadn’t had much sleep either if you counted the hours, but she woke steadily, throwing her good arm up to cover her eyes and groaned for the light of day and for the aching of her entire body.

Agatha shifted slowly to gaze down at her and dipped her head to capture her lips in a quick kiss. “Good morning.”

“Is it?” Rio asked with another groan, her drugs now worn off. Her arm lolling back down onto the pillow beside her head and she blinked slowly up at Agatha who somehow looked more tired than before.

“Did you sleep?”

Agatha dipped her head to steal another kiss but didn’t say anything until she offered, “Coffee? Meds?”

“Agatha,” Rio scolded softly, feeling something akin to sickness rising in her chest at the idea of Agatha not allowing herself to rest after everything that had happened. “Tell me you didn’t stay awake for me.”

But Agatha was already moving, already determined on coffee and drugs for Rio rather than conversation.

“Agatha,” Rio called to her retreating form but it was no use. She sat slowly then, her world spinning for a brief second as she settled herself back against the headboard and she focused on what she could control: which was everything but Agatha.

Taking long, slow breaths, she pushed the limit of her lung capacity, feeling a familiar raw ache across the band of her chest. She stretched out her arms slowly and flexed the muscles in her legs, feeling similar aches there. And she closed her eyes to focus on where the real damage was.

Agatha, Rio knew, was still torn between raging against Alice and softening herself for Rio. She was pulled between the intensity of her job and her desire to be with Rio. She was stuck between Rio and a Stark place.

Everything Rio had done since she’d met Agatha had been the wrong choice. She’d stubbornly continued to work whilst knowing it was a sore spot for Agatha. She’d seen how Agatha reacted every time she left her to meet a client, how she grabbed her and touched her when she came back from one, how she was slowly eating away at herself because of everything she’d promised Stark for Rio’s sake.

It was all because of her.

As the spiral hit its peak, Agatha appeared beside her, perching lightly on the side of the bed and placing a hot mug of coffee down beside the pills she needed to take on the side.

“Would a bath help?”

Rio’s eyes flashed open and to her horror she realised that tears were suddenly flowing, silent little traitors to her inner turmoil.

Warm fingers reached to wipe them gently and Agatha’s voice sounded so soft, so concerned as she asked, “Are you in pain?”

“Agatha,” Rio tried slowly, shuffling a little to try and get closer, wiping at her own cheeks roughly with the heel of her hand before she reached for Agatha again, “I am so sorry about all of this. About-…”

But Agatha cut her off with a quick shake of her head and a squeeze of her hands, “I don’t want to hear it, Rio. I don’t need to.”

“You do.”

Agatha laughed softly, but the laughter didn’t quite meet her eyes as she dropped her eyes to the bruise now splayed across Rio’s right side where the blankets had fallen down. She reached to ghost a finger over the edge of it and mumbled, “I hired you.”

Her eyes flashed up briefly to meet Rio’s and when she saw confusion there she looked back down again, “I just wanted you and when Wanda… that’s all on me.”

Rio shook her head no and reached back out for Agatha’s hand, placing it just below her left breast, above her heart, “What you’re doing now. You don’t need to do anymore. Tell Stark he can…”

Rio huffed unhappily, the guilt still settled between her stomach and chest, and she frowned up at Agatha, shifting forwards some more to grip the collar of her shirt and keep her close.

Blue eyes softened at the gesture and Agatha closed the distance again to kiss Rio once more, letting their noses nudge together. Rio closed her eyes into the movement and simply breathed Agatha in for a second before she spoke again:

“Are you working?”

“No. I’ve cancelled everything for a couple days. And,” she paused and pulled her hand from Rio but didn’t pull from her hold, “When I go back on Monday morning I was hoping you’d come with me. Permanently.”

A sharp pain suddenly slashed through Rio’s chest as she sucked in a heavy, unexpected breath and she winced so violently that Agatha looked panicked.

“Move in with you?”

Nodding slowly and raising her hands to cup Rio’s face, Agatha said with a newfound urgency to her voice, “I know you have a life here and I know it’s a big ask and that you’ll need time to think about it but-…”

“No.”

“No?”

Agatha’s fingers twitched uncertainly and then she pulled them away completely from Rio as Rio shifted and strained herself to move around Agatha and sit in her lap. “Agatha. I would love to move in with you.”

“Mi amor,” Rio uttered softly, leaning in to brush their lips together, trying to coax the Agatha she knew out of her frightened stupor, “I’ll tell you if you’re hurting me.”

The instruction was clear, firm, even as Agatha’s fingers still gripped Rio tightly to her and her lips brushed her skin.

“It’s not even been twenty four hours and I know you’re in pain.”

“Yes but I also want you. Preferably all over me. Preferably inside of me. Preferably-…”

“I just want you to take it easy today. And then…” Her brow twitched slightly and Rio couldn’t help but smile as she felt her hips being squeezed, “Then we can negotiate.”

“Negotiate? Oh now you want to negotiate.”

Agatha pursed her lips together but nodded and shifted slightly beneath Rio, one hand moving to the crook of her knee. “Rest here for a bit and I’ll go run it.”

“I’m practically naked and you won’t touch me. Maybe I’ll kill Alice too.”

But this joke didn’t settle well across Agatha’s features and something in her hardened again, her jaw now tense as she stood from the bed.

“She’s been calling all morning.”

“She has? And you haven’t picked up?”

“Obviously.”

“Agatha. She loves you so much. She spent all night telling me how much she loves you.”

“It doesn’t matter,” Agatha said flatly, turning from Rio and stalking out of the room without so much as a backwards glance.

Rio was left alone with the very real possibility that Agatha would never speak to Alice again.

She toyed with the blankets beneath her and tried to reason how she’d feel if Natasha had done the same to Agatha. How sick with rage she’d be. How intent on making Natasha feel the same pain. But… she knew Natasha loved her. She knew that if she ever did anything to Agatha she’d do it because she loved her.

And so she couldn’t reason it. Not yet.

When the sounds of the bath filling stopped, Rio padded through to the bathroom with her half-finished coffee and raised a brow at the sheer amount of bubbles she found in the tub.

“Did you drop something?”

“Shut up. This stuff’s expensive. And soothing.”

Rio smiled at this and turned to Agatha to see watching her, her eyes looking heavier than before.

“Will you take a nap later? I’ll sit away from you if it’ll make you feel better about actually sleeping.”

“I’m fine.”

“You’re not.”

“Rio,” her voice more firm now, she turned to the younger woman properly, her brows raised. “Leave it.”

Rio just shook her head and moved forwards to tug Agatha’s shirt up slightly, letting her do the rest for herself so she didn’t have to stretch her arms up. “Now would be a perfect time to-…”

“Stop it,” Agatha warned quietly, but slapped Rio’s ass firmly enough that it made Rio gasp and she turned over her shoulder to glare at Agatha.

“Oh that’ll help.”

Agatha scoffed but offered her hand out and half supported Rio into the bath, letting her settle herself in the middle before she stepped in behind her and guided Rio back against her.

They were silent for a long while, Rio focusing on Agatha’s breathing to calm her own, her fingers lightly running up and down the arm across her body.

It was Agatha who spoke first.

“I could support you, you know. If you didn’t want to work.”

Rio didn’t react immediately to these words, having heard similar before when Agatha had tried to get her to change her career and she knew an instinctive, stubborn “no” wouldn’t ease Agatha’s stress so she paused before speaking again, “I wouldn’t be happy not doing anything. I need to work. I’ll find something. But…” she turned as best she could to look at Agatha and watched as Agatha dipped her head to press a kiss to her shoulder.

“Thank you.”

Agatha hummed slightly and Rio felt her hand brush slowly up to settle in her left side and squeeze her there as she turned back around to face down the bath.

“Maybe you could be a landscaper after all.”

“I do like plants.”

“And how many of them are going to be moving with you?”

“Oh all of them. Non-negotiable.”

Agatha laughed softly but said nothing else on the subject, her fingers tapping a soft pattern against Rio’s uninjured ribs.

Until the temperature of the bath water was no longer tenable and most of the bubbles were gone, the two of them sat there, Rio thinking of how she was going to break the news of her moving to her team, to Natasha, and Agatha thinking of how she could make Rio’s pain subside, how she could possibly continue a relationship with Alice when all she wanted to do was murder her.

By the time they got out and Agatha helped Rio dry off and change - being frustratingly gentle and proper with her if you asked Rio - it was around midday and Rio was starving.

Agatha deposited her on the couch and left her to get settled so she could fetch them some lunch, making the most of what she had available and producing a veritable smorgasbord of charcuterie, hummus, bread, and cheese.

Tucked into the corner of the tray of food was something that Rio wasn’t expecting at all and she stared at it for a long while before she even registered what it was.

“You’re kidding.”

“Alice is useful for some things,” Agatha said coolly, running a hand through her hair as she reached for a celery stick.

Rio reached around her and winced at the strain on her side as she tentatively picked up the neat little joint, holding it below her nose to smell the contents as she stared wide-eyed at Agatha.

“Are you going to join me?”

“Eat first,” Agatha instructed, stealing the joint back and motioning to the food.

Rio rolled her eyes but couldn’t hold out any longer and she soon made quick work of the food before her, eating readily even as her eyes kept flicking back to Agatha, watching her curiously as the older woman’s gaze turned every so often to her phone that lit up every few seconds.

“You should speak to her.”

“No.”

Rio sighed quietly and reached for Agatha’s phone but it was snatched from her before she could reach it and she scowled at Agatha.

“You’re being unreasonable.”

“Rio,” Agatha said flatly, her gaze hardened now, “I have restrained myself from ripping her fucking head off. You can’t ask any more of me than that.”

“That is…”

But Agatha was moving already, picking up the little joint and placing it between her lips to light it.

Rio rolled her eyes and leant back to watch Agatha’s movements, the sight of her inhaling the smoke not doing anything to calm Rio’s need for her.

But Agatha was quick about it, not luxuriating in the warm burn of the smoke as it hit her lungs and instead exhaling quickly, fully, before she handed the lit joint to Rio, brushing their fingers together as she did.

Rio kept her gaze on Agatha and with more practiced movements than the other woman she raised the joint to her own lips and inhaled slowly, deeply, feeling the rush of the putrid smoke hitting her lungs and causing her pain to peak as she expanded her chest with it.

Lithe fingers moved up and down Rio’s calf as she closed her eyes and focused on the slow, creeping sensation of calm wash over her.

Soon enough, her mind felt hazy, her body no longer aching beneath her as she lazily took another drag, humming quietly to herself as she draped her arm over the couch and tapped the joint lightly over the floor.

“It’s unbelievable how good you look right now.”

“Yeah? I feel good.”

Agatha laughed and squeezed at Rio’s thigh, still watching her closely, “No more pain?”

“Not much.”

“I thought this was just for me?”

“You won’t share?”

Rio laughed, more than she would have if she were sober, and shrugged her shoulders, not registering the fact that it hurt a lot less than this would have done an hour ago.

“I suppose I could.”

“Fuck, Agatha. I’m fine. I’m-…”

But Agatha was shaking her head, looking suddenly incandescent with rage again.

“No. You’re not fine and I shouldn’t have let myself forget that.”

“Fuck,” Rio said again, too hazy to think of how she could course correct this, how she could adjust the tension in the room from thick and alert back to soft and desperate.

“Please. Please just come back here.”

She remained lying down but held her arm out lamely, wriggling her fingers in the hopes Agatha would take them and return to her position over her.

But she didn’t. She turned to stub out the joint and slowly lowered herself on the couch by Rio’s feet, lifting them again so she could slide a little closer but not leaning over Rio anymore.

“I’m sorry,” she admitted, glancing around at Rio with a pained expression.

Rio sighed heavily and moved a hand up to experimentally touch her injured side as she watched Agatha. “It wasn’t your fault.”

But Agatha didn’t respond to this and Rio was too zoned out to be of any use to her racing mind.

So she reached a hand to find Agatha’s and remained quiet, watching the thoughts play out across Agatha’s side profile and slowly, reluctantly slipping into a hazy sleep.

The next thing she felt was the dull ache in her chest and the return of the sharp sting as she shifted slightly.

But the last thing she felt was a sense of dread as she registered the key that now turned in the lock, and the sound of footsteps making their way into the apartment.

It was Jen’s voice that woke Agatha and caused her to jerk up, blinking into the light of the room as she announced: “You fucking bitch.”

Rio sat up slowly and instinctively moved to block Agatha from getting up even as she made a move to. She grabbed at her side and threw her other arm to rest on her head, knowing Agatha wouldn’t throw her off.

“Don’t,” she warned quickly, quietly, even as Jen turned to stand the other side of the coffee table, looking regal in a matching lilac track suit that must have cost more than Rio could even fathom.

Alice stood by her side, looking worried and tired and far less poised than Jen.

“Get out of my house,” Agatha snapped, her hands moving to try and peel Rio away from her but her eyes on Jen.

“You kicked my wife out of your fucking house at three in the morning!”

“Your wife beat up my girlfriend!”

At this, Rio groaned quietly and began to tug at Agatha’s collar, trying to get her to turn away.

“Don’t. Agatha. Don’t.”

“Oh fuck off Rio, piss off back to your other girlfriend and…”

Jen’s words were the catalyst for a chemical reaction.

No, a nuclear bomb going off in the room.

Alice had known, just as Rio had, what was about to happen. She’d stepped infront of Jen, holding her arms out behind her to create some sort of human barrier, and Rio had thrown herself in front of Agatha even as the woman had stood up, trying her best to be gentle but forcibly removing Rio from herself as she managed to get to her feet.

Her previously thunderous expression was now livid. Her jaw jutting forwards and her finger pointing accusingly at the beauty mogul, now behind Alice.

“Don’t you dare speak to her like that.”

“Like what?” Jen accused suddenly, her pitch rising with every word, “Like she’s a-…”

But the word didn’t make it out of her mouth because Agatha had released a noise halfway between a scream and a growl and had thrown herself across the table to get to Jennifer.

Alice threw her weight at Agatha to hold her back as she clambered over the low coffee table to get to her. But Agatha wasn’t letting up.

Alice struggled to keep a hold on her, growling in effort and stumbling backwards, as Agatha tried to reach around her to get at Jen who, despite having known what she was about to unleash, looked shocked and more than a little frightened.

Rio had moved around quickly, stepping behind Alice and helping as best she could to push her back into Agatha to keep Agatha from overpowering her completely. It took everything she had not to scream in agony as her chest battled her and Agatha’s yells filled the room. “Agatha!”

Agatha released another angry yell and finally pulled back from Alice, her gaze flickering briefly to check on Rio before she turned with her arms thrown out to the room as she did so, her gaze still furious.

She and Alice were both panting heavily and Agatha’s cheeks were red form the effort.

“What! What do you want? You’re lucky I didn’t kill your fucking wife.”

“Agatha,” Rio repeated again, now clear of any flying limbs so she could step towards her and press a hand down against her chest. “You need to calm down.”

“My fucking wife was trying to defend you. Because your head is so far up your own ass that you have been lying to us for months and you’re too fucking proud to admit that you’ve been paying for a fake girlfriend!”

“Jen that’s not…,” Alice corrected with a frown but was cut off as Agatha yelled over her from her position with Rio guarding her.

“You have no fucking clue what you’re talking about.”

“Agatha,” Alice spoke quickly, firmly, “I thought Rio was… I was just trying to-…”

But Jen jumped in again, throwing a hand out dismissively, “Don’t apologise! You were trying to protect her!”

Rio sighed heavily as Agatha’s gaze hardened again and she shot Jen a look that could wither even the boldest of spirits.

“Don’t apologise? You’ve got some fucking balls, Jennifer Kale!”

“Agatha,” Rio sighed quietly, now turning around to face Jen and Alice, holding her hands up in front of her, “Can we please just all calm down. Alice and I…”

“Enough from you,” Jen shot out, throwing a hand out towards Rio.

Agatha behind her growled then, her voice rising to levels it hadn’t even been the previous night, “GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY FUCKING HOUSE!”

“Agatha,” both Alice and Rio tried, both now rounding on her, Rio turning around and Alice stepping in.

But Agatha was beyond reason and she refused both of their hands reaching out to her as she stepped back from them.

“There she goes,” Jen called in accusation, “shutting everyone out so that the only person who will even tolerate her is someone who…”

But it wasn’t Agatha who shut Jen up this time. It was Rio.

Rio had wheeled around and with her good arm, smacked Jen across the face with an anger she hadn’t known she’d been holding back.

“Jen,” Alice gasped and moved to fuss her, nudging past Rio as she did so. She pushed Jen away gently as Jen clutched her cheek and stared in shock at an equally shocked Rio.

But strong arms were snaking around her waist and Agatha pressed firmly up behind her as if to keep her tethered, keeping her hold low so as to avoid her ribs as she moved them back a couple paces.

“I-…” Rio started but found she had nothing to say. She wanted to apologise but couldn’t bring herself to. The weight of Agatha pressing behind her reminding her that she’d probably break Jen’s whole body if it meant defending her, let alone just slapping her. But her mouth opened and closed a few more times as she watched Alice check on her wife, watched Jen continue to stare at her, and heard Agatha’s voice in her ear, low and soft, just for her.

“Don’t, Rio. Don’t.”

Rio relented fully then, allowing herself to be pulled further away and moved to stand the furthest from Jen and Alice as Agatha turned them, her hands still either side of her as she kept her away from the other two.

Blue eyes had softened a little, but she still looked ready to strike at any moment and her hands squeezed Rio possessively as she watched for any signs that she’d further hurt herself.

“Rio is my girlfriend,” Agatha said firmly, her voice carrying this time, even as she kept her gaze on the shocked woman before her, “I am in love with her. I hired her to be my date to your wedding and I fell for her and we have been together ever since. She’s an escort and I’ve had my problems with it but… her job is her choice. I kept it from you because I wanted to protect her. I wanted to…”

She shook her head and moved a hand up to wipe the silent tears that had begun to fall from Rio’s wide eyes, “I wanted to keep her safe and I didn’t feel I needed to explain what we had to anyone.”

The silence in the room then was thick, dangerous, and Rio bit down on her lower lip as Agatha shifted her hold on her and turned to look around finally at Jen and Alice, raising her chin up as she did.

“If either of you have a problem with me or Rio or our relationship then you can get the fuck out and never contact me again.”

Rio’s heart was in her throat and she watched as both Jen and Alice stared across at their best friend.

Alice seemed to be fighting back tears, her face scrunched up and small.

Jen still looked shocked, whether from Rio’s slap or Agatha’s admission, she couldn’t be sure.

But Rio was mostly concerned about Agatha and she moved forwards to take her hand and gave it a gentle squeeze as Agatha pulled her a little closer, not looking at her but keeping her gaze on the other two.

It was Alice again who spoke first, “I’ll spend forever being sorry for what I did. But if you’ll let me I’d-… I want to… don’t shut me out.”

Rio breathed in shakily at these words, and fought back more of her own tears as she caught Alice’s eye and nodded slightly, her free hand moving to clutch Agatha’s in her other hand. But Agatha didn’t move, didn’t react, just gazed over at Jen who looked reluctant to say much of anything.

Just as Rio thought that this was it, that Jen was giving her answer by giving none at all, she spoke and Alice turned to hold her arm steadily, “You’re a maniac, you know that?”

Agatha sniffed beside Rio and a little bit of tension was released in her shoulders as Jen’s gaze flicked back to Rio, “I hope you know what you’re getting yourself into.”

Rio felt like a weight had been lifted, and the tension in the room around them slowly dissipated as Jen’s body relaxed into Alice’s side and Agatha’s thumb brushed across Rio’s knuckles.

“She knows,” Agatha said with a huff that was haughty but no longer angry.

Jen nodded once and pursed her lips as she glanced briefly at her wife now smiling across at Rio.

“You owe me a lotta money for the last minute flight by the way.”

“Oh sure,” Agatha shot out with an eye roll as she pulled away from Rio to sit down in her chair. She tugged a little on Rio’s arm as she did so and guided her into her lap as she rolled her shoulders back and kept her gaze on Jen. “Worth it for the slap though, right?”

“Bitch,” Jen muttered as she tugged Alice along with her to the couch and pulled her down beside her with a huff.

Agatha’s arms slipped snuggly around Rio, always cautious of her injured side, but holding her more firmly than she had all day.

Rio felt insane. She was torn between fury at Jen, affection for Alice, and concern for Agatha. But there was nothing she could do. And she focused on the fact that Agatha had at least seemed to calm down, that she was speaking at a normal volume, and that her eyes no longer burned with the fury of a thousand suns.

So, as she stretched in Agatha’s hold she finally said, looking over at Jen, “Sorry about that.”

“Don’t apologise,” Agatha chided with a scowl, “she deserved it.”

Rio sighed and leant her left side more into Agatha, draping her arm around the back of her neck as she did so. Her free hand now rubbing up and down Agatha’s tense bicep.

“I’m quitting, by the way. After what’s happened. It’s not worth it. The woman Alice saw me with, she was my last client.”

Alice blinked over at Rio and looked sheepish, unsure how she should react to this but Jen spoke before anyone else could. “Hope she was at least hot.”

“Jen,” Agatha snapped suddenly, her hold on Rio tightening a little even as Rio’s fingers moved to squeeze her shoulder reassuringly.

“Wouldn’t you rather she was with someone at least palatable than some ugly old…” but she shut up as Alice dug her elbow into her ribs.

“What will you do?”

“I don’t know. I’ll figure something out. I’m good with people,” Jen snorted at this and received another glare from Agatha.

Alice spoke quickly to keep Jen from commenting, “I could maybe find you something? You can hold your own. You’d be good in security.”

Rio smiled at this and raised her brows, “You are smaller than me and you managed to-…”

But Alice was grinning already, “You were holding back. I could tell.”

Rio hummed and fought back a laugh even as she felt Agatha’s fingers tighten their grip on her thigh and pull her a bit closer as she sat sideways in her lap.

“Would you goddamn let go of her already,” Jen said suddenly, clearly already comfortable throwing out more insults. “You’re obsessed. It’s gross.”

“It’s hot,” Alice corrected with a smirk as she turned back to Jen and took her hand, “There was a time when you couldn’t keep your hands off me.”

“Other way around,” Jen said with a smirk and narrowed her eyes at Alice playfully.

Rio laughed as she watched them kiss and jumped a little in surprise as Agatha murmured against her ear, “They were disgusting.”

She held in a snort and glanced down at Agatha with an amused smirk, “Unlike us?”

“Exactly.”

Rio rolled her eyes and reached to trace her finger lightly down Agatha’s nose, watching her carefully as she saw the tension slowly disappear from her features. But her hold remained strong.

Jen’s voice broke them out of their joint reverie and Rio glanced back at her with raised brows as she heard her question.

“So, Rio, what’s your body count?”

“What?”

“How many notches on your bed-“

“Jen.”

“What? We all know each others. Alice is twelve, I’m four, you’re-…”

“Jen-…”

“Forty two.”

Rio looked between Agatha and Jen and saw that whilst one was smirking triumphantly the other was looking incredibly pissed off.

She hesitated for a second before answering coolly, “A little more than forty two.”

“How much more?”

Rio scoffed quietly and shifted in Agatha’s hold, moving her hand to fiddle with her collar.

“A little.”

Agatha had shifted too and slid her hand up her thigh to encircle her arm more around her. “Can you just leave her alone?”

Rio’s hand then slid down to rest above Agatha’s heart, glancing down at her as she felt it race beneath her palm.

“It’s fine,” she said with a shrug, “I’ve had worse questions.”

“So we’re talking… over a hundred?”

Agatha rolled her eyes, and cleared her throat, her jaw set. “Jen. Are you trying to live vicariously through my girlfriend or something?”

Rio laughed and felt the slight twinge in her side she did so but she kept her hands on Agatha.

“Come on, my wife can beat her up but I can’t ask any questions?”

“You think I allowed that?”

Sensing the mood changing already, Rio cleared her throat and leant forward, recognising danger when it was directly in front of her.

“I’ve slept with a lot of women. Probably more than the majority of people. Clients and non-clients. I always had a choice with what I did and who I did it with. Less so in the beginning, but definitely as I got better at what I did and knew my own mind and limits more.”

She felt Agatha’s fingers twitch slightly against her and she glanced aside at her before turning back to an intrigued Jen.

It was Alice who spoke next though, before Rio could continue to answer the questions she thought they’d most likely want to know the answers too, “You were so… yourself though. With Agatha, with us, I mean. It didn’t feel… it was you.”

Rio raised her brows in surprise and she felt Agatha shift a little. She briefly looked to her and turned back to Alice with a slight smile, “It wasn’t as if I’d always put on a front for clients, be different with them… but with Agatha, with you both, it was easier to be me, yes.”

Agatha rolled her eyes at this but something in her gaze let Rio know she was pleased. Rio’s hand moved back from under her sweater and into her own lap again as she turned away with a grin. “Plus Jen would have seen through my bullshit and Lilia wasn’t being fooled by anything.”

“Damn right,” Jen said with a hint of pride, “Besides, at this point I’m not even sure what this one would have wanted you to be. Probably just sexy arm candy.”

Agatha laughed at this and shot Jen a glare, “Don’t be insane. If I’d rocked up with someone without a personality you’d have never let me forget it.”

“I was surprised you rocked up with anyone at all.”

Agatha just shook her head and leant back in her seat, her stance widening as she did so and Rio recognised the telltale sign of her peacocking to get back on top of the conversation. Rio slipped a little in between her thighs and adjusted herself accordingly.

“And yet here we are. Your wife an asshole who punches before she thinks.”

“Agatha-,” Rio said quickly, snapping her head around to her with wide eyes, “Don’t.”

But Jen was moving, leaning forwards and suddenly looking livid. “If you had just stopped being a bitch and admitted that you’d fallen for an escort then we wouldn’t be in this mess.”

Alice reached for Jen then, her hand wrapping around her arm and gently holding her in place. “Jen, really. I take full responsibility for what I did to Rio.”

“Of course you do,” Agatha sneered across at her just as Rio leant over a little more, almost to block her from view and winced at the movement, frowning deeply at her.

“Agatha. There’s no point.”

Agatha scowled but nodded slightly and clearly decided to drop it as she turned back to her two best friends, and Rio settled back again too.

“So,” Rio tried quickly, clearing her throat as she focused in on Alice’s concerned features, but it was pointless. The mood in the room had changed.

Agatha was so tense, so coiled and ready to bite that everyone knew it. Jen looked like she could rip someone’s head off and the hopes of a more chilled evening slowly disappeared.

“Rio,” Alice tried quietly, watching her with a wide gaze as if willing her to pick up the conversation she was about to offer, “What will you do when Agatha goes on the campaign trail?”

Rio raised her brows and didn’t know how to answer but she knew she had to, if nothing else to keep the chat away from her job, away from anything that might cause either Agatha or Jen to blow up again.

“I don’t know. That’s…”

“We haven’t discussed it yet,” Agatha said curtly, uncomfortable with this line of questioning too. “But Rio’s going to move in.”

“Here?”

“No. Home.”

Rio watched closely as Alice smiled at the news and Jen raised her brows, “And what? Be your little wifey? Available for a quick fuck and a-…”

But she received an elbow to her ribs once again and shut up, scowling a little at her own wife.

“That’s great news.”

Rio bit down on her lip to stop herself from laughing even as Agatha’s face told her it wasn’t something to find funny.

“You’re such a cunt.”

“Agatha,” Rio chided quietly, turning back to her and frowning deeply, but Agatha ignored her and simply pursed her lips as she continued to glare at Jen.

“Sweetheart,” Alice offered soothingly to her wife, shifting to kneel up beside her and place a kiss to her temple as she muttered, “You’re going to get us killed.”

Jen just scoffed but soon relented and rolled her eyes, clearly Alice had somehow worked her magic on her.

“Look, fine. I don’t have a problem with…” she gestured vaguely to Rio and Agatha, “Whatever this is. Just…” she rolled her eyes again and looked away, “Just don’t fuck it up, okay? I’m not going through that again. She was a fucking mental case and…” she trailed off, brown eyes meeting Rio’s and softening slightly, “Just don’t fuck it up.”

Rio swallowed and nodded slowly, not dropping her gaze from Jen even as Agatha shifted beneath her and moved her hand to slip below Rio’s tshirt to hold her more intimately. “I won’t. I love her. I won’t.”

After that, things eased up a little.

Agatha was still finding it difficult to make eye contact with Alice and at one point she cleared her throat very loudly when she walked into the kitchen and saw her and Rio hugging, but she didn’t say anything, didn’t mention the broken rib again.

Rio spent the majority of the evening feeling a little out of it with the strong pain meds she was on but Agatha’s hands were never far from her, grounding her in some sort of reality.

They ordered in pizza and Alice, Jen, and Agatha shared two bottles of wine between them. At some point around midnight Rio had fallen asleep against Agatha and Alice wasn’t far behind, curled up beside Jen. It was only then that Jen broached the subject of their relationship again, but softer this time on account of their sleeping partners.

“Are you sure this is a good idea?”

“Jen-…”

“Hear me out, okay? She might have quit but I’m sure she wasn’t some street corner…”

At the sight of Agatha’s glare she backtracked and sighed, “I mean, she would have fancy ass clients. People in the know, people with power and money and… won’t going public with her be difficult?”

Agatha clenched her jaw a little but spoke coolly, “I’m in love with her. What else is there?”

Jen didn’t respond immediately and instead looked down at Alice with a frown, “I just don’t want you to get hurt again.”

“Rio isn’t Wanda.”

“I know.”

She swirled her wine before downing the rest of it and then announced quietly, “We should go. I’m exhausted and Alice gets a bad back if she’s not in a proper bed.”

Agatha just scoffed but watched silently as Jen gently woke her wife and they both stood to move over, Alice looking a little frustrated at being woken already.

Jen leant in and kissed Agatha softly on the temple, briefly touching Rio’s shoulder, before she moved to leave the room.

Alice hesitated before she kissed Agatha’s cheek, and, not receiving any backlash from the move, she pressed another kiss to Rio’s, and then left without a word.

When Agatha heard the lock click she rubbed at her temples heavily, closing her eyes as she focused on Rio breathing soundly against her.

She let her sleep for another ten minutes before she gently shifted her and began to press soft kisses across her cheeks and nose, trying to coax her out of her slumber.

“Honey,” she whispered softly as Rio began to stir and groaned a little, “Let me take you to bed.”

Rio huffed out a breath through her nose but acquiesced and eventually Agatha had manoeuvred her into the bed. Rio was so tired that she barely registered getting there in the first place, her body limb and malleable as Agatha removed her clothes and tucked her into the crook of her arm beside her.

Agatha slept soundly for the first time since she’d last seen Rio over a week ago and it was Rio who woke first the next morning, her body sore but warm and comfortable against the woman she’d be waking up to every morning from now on.

Chapter End Notes

Jen will definitely come round

And Alice is thrilled with her new best friend. Rest assured she’ll be getting Rio’s number.

Also wanted to clear something up: Rio is 36, Agatha is 41.

Aaaand Agatha will be less withholding soon she is just a scared baby

Pushing It

Chapter Summary

In which Alice and Jen arrive again and Agatha’s self-control is being tested

Chapter Notes

Rio really is her own worst enemy in this one

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The following day was spent mostly on the couch, with Rio, in between her naps, constantly attempting to seduce Agatha, to make her relax enough to touch her, to kiss her, to do anything more than she was currently doing.

But Agatha didn’t give more than an inch. She allowed Rio to kiss up her neck, to nip at her ear lobe, even to grind slowly against her, but she always held her steady, held her firmly away from her, insistent that Rio rest.

Secretly, in a very small part of her that Rio would never admit to having, she was pleased of this. Agatha had looked positively feral when Rio had ground her hips down against her thigh at one point in the morning and yet she’d held off, she hadn’t done anything other than hold Rio so she’d stop, her blue eyes flashing dangerously even as her lips said “no.”

It was a slow and subtle power game that Rio was, to the unobservant outsider, definitely losing.

But Rio, and Agatha, both knew that Rio was winning. That Agatha was destined to lose control at some point. When Rio was better. When she could handle it. When she could reap the rewards of teasing her girlfriend.

Rio’s body still ached, still burnt every time she twisted or moved suddenly, but her pain meds took the brunt of the pain away. But she wanted Agatha so desperately, wanted her to be her usual self with her. She wanted to feel normal and to be normal.

And so even as Agatha remained stoic in her insistence that Rio relax, that she rest, Rio kept pushing.

But their push and pull was soon interrupted by Jen and Alice who had no qualms about barging in to the apartment as Rio had been insistently kissing along Agatha’s jaw, promising her all the things they could do now she had unlimited time and they had many rooms to christen in Agatha’s large D.C. home.

And soon she was lounging with Alice on the couch, laughing along with each other good-naturedly as they shared another joint.

This was the only time Agatha had released her hold on Rio for longer than it took one of them to go to the bathroom and she watched with cautious eyes as her girlfriend and her best friend bonded over a mutual hatred of the Lakers.

“Golden ball bastards,” Rio had announced much to Alice’s glee.

“Little bitches,” Alice agreed. And they both broke down into fits of giggles.

“Understand any of that?” Jen asked suspiciously as she frowned over at her wife and her wife’s apparent new best friend.

“No. Or that she’s forgiven her so easily.”

Jen rolled her eyes and slapped Agatha’s arm lightly, “She told me everything, you know. Rio really did hold back. Maybe she does love you.”

Agatha scoffed but flexed her jaw and said nothing as she watched Rio gasp for air, her head lolling backwards as she rolled almost off the couch.

Agatha made a move as if to go catch her to ask Rio to be more careful, but Jen held her back from their position at the small, round dining table just off the living room.

“She’s fine. Leave her be.”

Agatha sighed then, turning more to Jen fully and raising her brows, “How long are you planning on being a bitch about her?”

“Oh, probably forever.”

“Great. Just so we’re clear.”

Jen scoffed and turned to Agatha too, raising her brows at her. “So. Rio was telling Alice that you’ve sold your soul. I knew it was bad but… I didn’t know it was that bad.”

“It’s not. It’s fine. It’ll be over soon.”

“Agatha, you have another year of this. And it’s only going to get worse. Besides, now she’s not an active escort, what is he holding over you? He got your nudes or something?”

Agatha’s gaze narrowed at Jen briefly before she turned back to gaze across at Rio, her expression softening as she took the sight in of her still giggling. Rio was now draped across the sofa like an expensive throw, her grin somehow lopsided even as she continued to throw out more and more random insults about various basketball teams.

“It’s not Stark. It’s Wanda. She was the one who found out about Rio and she’s been… in contact ever since. Turns out that she either wants Rio or she wants President Tony Stark. So I’ll make it happen and she’ll leave her alone.”

Jen frowned deeply at this information, lifting a finger up to experimentally touch her frown lines between her eyes to see how much of her skin had moved and whether she’d need a few extra CC’s next time.

“Leave her alone? What? She’s sexting her?”

Agatha rolled her eyes and frowned back at Jen, slapping her hand away from where she’d now been tugging the skin around her eyes back to test the elasticity.

“No. She wants to embarrass her. To shame her. She wants to use her to get to me. And I won’t let it happen.”

Jen surveyed her best friend in silence for a few seconds, watching her jaw flex, her chin lift, and then, ultimately, her gaze move back to Rio and she felt a deep affection for the woman she’d known all these years.

Moving subtly to reach across for Agatha’s forearm she lowered her voice and said, “Okay but does Rio know this? Because from what she told Alice she’s not exactly thrilled with what you’ve got going on with Stark.”

Agatha released a humourless laugh and threw her head back, pulling her arm away from Jen, “She offered to sleep with her to make it go away.”

“And?” Jen pulled back with a sudden beaming grin, holding her hands up in triumph, “Yay! Easy! Solves the problem!”

A subtle shift in Agatha’s expression though told her that it was not a solution Agatha was at all interested in and Jen scowled, her look of jubilation disappearing suddenly, “You’re kidding. She offered to sleep with her so that you wouldn’t actually combust over the next year and you said no?”

“If it were Alice?” Agatha nodded her head towards the woman now sitting cross-legged on the floor by Rio’s head, listing off players in the WNBA she thought she could beat in a 1-1 game.

Jen’s gaze fell to her wife then too and her scowl softened and then disappeared altogether. “I’d burn the world.”

Agatha didn’t say anything after that but continued to watch Rio with an unreadable expression on her face, the sight of her so at ease with Alice making her feel less than okay but more than uncomfortable.

It was Jen who broke the silence again and Agatha sighed quietly, “What’s stopping Wanda from exposing her anyway? Even when it’s all done?”

Agatha chewed on the inside of her cheek and huffed out a slow breath, “I’m working on that.”

Jen raised her brows in question but said nothing for a second before she pivoted, “And this moving in thing… is it fair? Rio moving to D.C. when you’ll practically be flying all over the country in the next few months. Doesn’t she have that friend here? Natalie? Wouldn’t it be kinder to not move in?”

“Natasha,” Agatha corrected with an arched brow. “And she’ll kill your wife before I do.”

“Oh stop being such a bitch. Her name is Alice and she’s loved you longer than anyone else in the world. Took me years,” she added with a smirk and poked at Agatha’s arm.

Agatha shot Jen a glare but softened a little, “I’m hoping she’ll come with me.”

“All those disgusting motels? All that godawful political chat? I’d rather die.”

“You think I stay in motels?”

“Hey, you hire hookers, who knows what else you get up to.”

Agatha had to bite down on the inside of her cheek to stop herself from laughing, not wanting to give Jen the satisfaction. “If I can’t call Alice ‘your wife’, you can’t call Rio a…”

But her words were interrupted by a kamikaze in the form of a high as shit Rio Vidal landing in her lap with a soft ‘oomf’.

“Rio,” Agatha shouted in warning even as her arms wrapped securely around the still giggling woman who only briefly looked a little uncomfortable, her brow furrowing even as she still laughed.

“Jump on me, Alice, and you will be sleeping on the couch!”

Alice, who was approaching with a loud laugh continued to laugh even as she took the gentler approach and slipped into Jen’s lap. Jen had opened her arms to her wife even as she’d chastised her.

Rio was now trying to claw at her neck, trying to pull Agatha closer and pressing as close as she could to her as if she could crawl into her skin.

“Rio,” Agatha whispered soothingly, her hands holding her steady at her hips, that same firm hold she’d been keeping on her all day. A self-preservation mechanism as well as a means of trying to keep Rio safe, unharmed.

“I love you,” Rio beamed, a soft laugh escaping her lips again as she pressed her face fully against Agatha’s, kissing her lazily, a little off kilter, not quite catching her lips properly.

Agatha had to move back slightly from this, her smile threatening to break her face in half as she watched Rio, her pupils fully dilated in her already dark eyes.

“Honey,” she murmured, one hand moving to rub up her good side, “You are on another planet.”

As Rio laughed again, but her face creased slightly as her ribs began to fight the excess work she’d been putting them through, Jen spoke, “How come your girlfriend laughs and my wife cries?”

“I do not cry,” Alice protested suddenly, though Agatha looked around to see her friend in tears and couldn’t help but laugh at her.

“Must be because she’s married to you.”

“Fuck off, Harkness.”

“I just love you all so much,” Alice sniffed, her own hands pawing at Jennifer’s neck, “And Rio. Rio is the best. I want you to get married and make enough babies so we can have a basketball team and-…”

But Rio had interrupted this spiel with a loud laugh and she leant away from Agatha, despite Agatha’s protests, to reach for Alice and try to tug her closer into a perilous hug.

“Alice, estás loca.”

Agatha grunted with the effort of Rio pulling so fully away from her and trying to hold her at the strange angle that she was now at without holding her in a way that would hurt.

“Rio, honey.”

“Fucksake, what is wrong with you two,” Jen huffed as Alice moved in the same way as Rio to capture her in a hug.

“Jen could you-…”

But Alice had made contact, mostly due to Jen not bothering to hold her back or help facilitate this mid-air hug, and Rio released a sound that was halfway between a laugh and a cry of pain.

“Shit,” Agatha growled, leaning fully in now to pull at Rio and try to untangle her arms from Alice. “Alice get the fuck-…”

“Sweetheart,” Jen chided quietly, pulling now at Alice, “You’re hurting her and Agatha is mad enough.”

Alice released a howl then, beginning to properly cry, and she pulled away even as Rio stubbornly held on and caused Agatha to huff unhappily, “Rio. Please.”

Soon enough Rio was back fully in her lap with wide eyes and a slight pallor that hadn’t been there before.

Rio felt hazy, more hazy than she had been even as she was hurling out insults to the universe about some of the best basketball players in the world. Agatha span before her even as she sat still and Rio’s grip on her collar went a little slack.

“I need to,” Rio started slowly, her voice breaking, “I need to…”

Rio swallowed down what she needed to do but began to move urgently, breaking Agatha’s hold on her and stumbling her way to the bathroom.

Agatha was hot on her tail and slammed the bathroom door shut behind them as Rio sank to her knees and proceeded to vomit into the waiting toilet.

Gentle hands moved to sweep dark hair up to hold it back and Agatha settled like a protective blanket around Rio, holding her gently as she wretched and cried.

Jen wasn’t far behind and barged in without knocking, grimacing at the sight and sounds.

“Christ. What a mess.”

“Out!” Agatha shouted, even as she continued to gently gather Rio’s hair and sweep it into a loose ponytail using the hair tie from her wrist.

Jen muttered something but disappeared from the little room again, leaving Agatha alone with Rio to soothe her as she continued to vomit from the exertion of the morning, from the mix of medication and weed in her system, and from the toll of the past two days.

By the time Rio had exhausted herself, her stomach now empty and her body screaming at her, she slumped back against Agatha and wiped at her eyes, “I’m sorry.”

“No,” Agatha shushed her gently, placing soft kisses to her cheek and temple as she leant around her more. “Nothing to be sorry for.”

Her hands reached to hold Rio’s and she pressed another gentle kiss to her cheek as she held her through her steadying breaths, “Do you need anything? Some water?”

Rio remained silent for a while, focusing on the steady breathing of Agatha pressed behind her and using it as a meditative rhythm to dissipate the pain emanating from her chest.

It was clear to her then what she needed. She had Agatha around her, holding her, but the rest of her heart was somewhere across the city.

“Could you call Natasha?”

She felt Agatha’s breath hitch slightly then, and turned her face just slightly towards her but felt Agatha nod against her head, placing a soft kiss to her temple.

“Okay.”

Chapter End Notes

All of your love is SO SWEET AND I LOVE IT SO MUCH

Thanks for sticking with these idiots

I’m obsessed with them

This is a short excerpt from a much longer chapter but I thought I’d chop it up for the dramz soz

You can imagine how things go down next up

Old Friends

Chapter Summary

A proper intro to Natasha, through Rio’s eyes.

A shock for Alice.

A political manoeuvre for Agatha.

Chapter Notes

Whoops on the long chapter!! Had already chopped the previous chapter out of this one and edited down quite a bit so hopefully flow still okay. Sorry sorry

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Her hands reached to hold Rio’s and she pressed another gentle kiss to her cheek as she held her through her steadying breaths, “Do you need anything? Some water?”

Rio remained silent for a while, focusing on the steady breathing of Agatha pressed behind her and using it as a meditative rhythm to dissipate the pain emanating from her chest.
It was clear to her then what she needed. She had Agatha around her, holding her, but the rest of her heart was somewhere across the city.

“Could you call Natasha?”

She felt Agatha’s breath hitch slightly then, and turned her face just slightly towards her but felt Agatha nod against her head, placing a soft kiss to her temple.

“Okay.”

 

Agatha began to peel away slowly, reluctantly, keeping her hold on Rio for as long as she could. “Let me take you to bed first.”

Rio acquiesced, but requested she brush her teeth first, the tang of bile in her mouth a heady reminder she wanted rid of.

Agatha held her steady as she stood at the sink and brushed away the remnants of her indignity.

She could barely look at herself in the mirror, afraid to see the ghostly pallor and tired eyes staring back at her.

But when she looked up she caught Agatha’s gaze, as soft and concerned as ever and she reached back to her to pull her closer, feeling woozy now for different reasons.

Agatha held her carefully and then walked with her.

Alice was in the hall, waiting patiently to check on her friend, though still crying, but Agatha dismissed her with a look and Rio only smiled tightly at her as they passed.

Once Rio was safe and wrapped in plush blankets, Agatha disappeared to make the call to Natasha.

Though Rio had pulled her down for a quick, apologetic kiss before she’d hidden herself in the covers. Her high dissolved amidst the torrent of emotions now battering her tired mind and body.

Agatha left with a heaviness in her chest, leaving her heart tucked under the covers with Rio.

She’d saved Natasha’s number weeks ago, when the woman had left it scribbled on a note in Rio’s kitchen for emergencies. But she hadn’t thought she’d ever really need it.

“Hello.”

“It’s Agatha. Rio wants to see you.”

“What’s happened?”

“Could you come to us? I’m on Jane-…”

“What’s happened?”

“Apartment 7, 9 Jane Street.”

Agatha heard movement on the other end of the line and then nothing. She pulled the phone away from her ear and saw that Natasha had hung up.

Bitch. She thought.

Half an hour later, Agatha peeled away from Rio’s now sleeping form in the middle of the bed and went to buzz Natasha up after hearing the telltale sound of the intercom in the hall.

She waited impatiently by the door, tapping her foot.

A brief, sharp knock alerted her to Natasha’s arrival and she opened the door to Rio’s furious best friend.

“Where is she?”

Agatha pursed her lips at the impertinent question and stepped back to allow Natasha to enter, about to respond when she heard Jen’s voice from the entrance to the living room.

“God, this is her best friend? It’s a shame you don’t share because that would be an excellent three-…”

“Jen,” Agatha snapped even as she pointed in the direction of the bedroom.

Natasha barely glanced in Jen’s direction and stormed past Agatha to find Rio.

Swallowing down her anger at this, Agatha shoved at Jen’s shoulder as she went after the red head and Jen had the decency to at least look a little sorry. But just a little.

As Agatha caught up to Natasha and entered the bedroom after her she had to bite her tongue as she watched the woman slip onto the bed and stroke her girlfriend’s cheek.

She lingered uncertainly by the end of the bed, her fingers twitching as if to rip Natasha’s hands away from Rio, but she didn’t say anything.

How could she, when Rio had specifically asked for this. For her.

Natasha coaxed Rio from her sleep as if she’d done it a million times before, her tone soft and hushed and Agatha felt sick as she realised that she was speaking Spanish to her.

Something Agatha couldn’t do.

As Rio turned to Natasha and blinked into the light of the room Agatha moved a little closer, wanting Rio to know she was there. Wanting Rio to ask for her.

But Rio’s gaze was heavy and her movements slow as she winced and pushed herself up off the bed, moving to sit up.

Natasha’s hands went to touch Rio’s waist and both Rio and Agatha said a quick, “Don’t.”

Natasha pulled back a little, her eyes flying over Rio’s face and her body suddenly rigid, “Tell me.”

For the first time since she’d left her in the bed
Agatha’s gaze met Rio’s and she saw in it an unfamiliar hesitance. Rio had always looked at Agatha with certainty. Even when she was mad. Even when she hadn’t been sure about their relationship in the very beginning.

And Agatha felt her chest tighten at the sight of it.

But Rio was already looking back at Natasha, reaching for her to pull her hand into her lap.

Natasha allowed it and even as Agatha shifted uncomfortably, Natasha’s free hand cupped Rio’s cheek.

“Tell me.”

Rio glanced back at Agatha then, “Agatha.”

Agatha felt like Rio had slapped her. She was being dismissed. But she nodded and silently, reluctantly, left the two of them alone.

“You’re leaving the two of them alone together with a bed? My, my, you are sure she loves you.”

These words greeted Agatha as she stepped from the bedroom and she sneered over at Jen who smiled in amusement back at her.

“Fuck off, Jen.”

She dragged her by the arm back through to the living room and looked over to see Alice now curled up in her armchair, looking sheepish.

“Is she okay?”

Agatha didn’t respond and motioned instead for Alice to shift it, and when she did, she replaced her in the chair.

“I don’t know why she likes her so much. She’s such a-…”

“What?” Jen laughed, “a bitch? A bit like you? Yeah it’s a mystery.”

Agatha narrowed her eyes over at her best friend and ran a hand through her hair. “She asked for her. She…”

But she didn’t voice her fears. Knowing that speaking them to the universe would give them power. Lilia had got to her at least that much.

Agatha was able to give Rio time alone with Natasha for an hour before she had to intrude again. Only her respect for Rio’s love of Natasha made her pause at her own bedroom door and knock before entering.

She didn’t receive a response. So she came in anyway.

The sight before her almost made her collapse. Or scream. Or attack.

Rio was lying in a position she’d been in many times with Agatha: her head against her chest, her body curled in between her legs, Rio safe and warm encircled in her arms.

Only this time it wasn’t Agatha. It was Natasha.

“Was that Alice? In the hall when I arrived.”

The question took Agatha by surprise and she looked from Rio’s sleeping form to the asker, who sat up against the headboard, keeping her voice low and her arms still tight around her best friend.

“What? No. That was Jen.”

Natasha didn’t acknowledge the answer and instead said. “She told me everything.”

Green eyes flashed a little but otherwise Natasha gave nothing away, still talking in that frustratingly flat tone that made Agatha want to throttle her.

“I knew something was wrong when she didn’t tell me she was home safe.”

Agatha nodded once, having known already that Rio always checked in with Natasha before and after meeting clients and she was big enough to be pleased that Rio had someone else looking out for her but it stung all the same.

“Is she okay?”

“I’m here.”

Natasha raised her chin a little as she responded, and Agatha recognised the challenge she’d thrown her way but she didn’t rise to it, not whilst Rio was in the room, blissfully unaware of what was happening.

“Alice and Jen-…”

“Alice shouldn’t be anywhere near her.”

“Believe me I want to kill her too but-…”

“Then why is she still breathing?”

The question caught Agatha off guard again and she opened her mouth to respond but closed it just as quickly, a fist forming at her side.

“Rio won’t let me near her.”

“Rio doesn’t know what’s good for her.”

Agatha sneered at this, knowing it was another dagger thrown her way. But Natasha wasn’t done, wasn’t near being finished with the woman who now stood stockstill at the end of the bed.

“You’re not good enough for her.”

All semblance of decency disappeared from Agatha then, her mind catching up to what her body already knew: she wanted to rip Natasha away from Rio. She wanted to rip her head off.

“You’re in love with her?”

Natasha’s lips twitched slightly at this, her gaze raising from Agatha’s clenched fists up to meet her gaze.

“Am I.”

There it was again, that tone. That sickening flat tone that made Agatha want to scream, want to yell until she could force a reaction from this woman. Something that wasn’t smugly self-assured, something that didn’t stink of a confidence that Rio was hers.

“Rio’s made her choice. She’s moving in with me. And whether you-…”

“Your best friend attacked Rio not two days ago, broke her rib, and you thought then was a good time to ask her to move in. When she was at her most vulnerable. Don’t even get me started on her quitting her job to follow you.”

Agatha gaped at the woman before her, knowing that if Rio hadn’t been tucked in against her, she’d have destroyed Natasha Romanoff.

“How fucking dare-…”

But her voice had picked up, where Natasha’s had stayed low, soft, just an inch or two above Rio’s head, and Rio stirred unhappily, shifting to rub at her eyes and in a move that made Agatha see red, she’d turned her head into the warmth of Natasha’s chest and nuzzled against her.

Natasha didn’t break her gaze from Agatha and only moved a hand that had been below the blankets and on Rio’s waist up to hold her shoulder gently, “Your girlfriend’s here.”

Rio groaned quietly and rubbed at her eyes, turning to blink across at Agatha. The sight before her made her frown and she shifted in her position, wincing a little as she turned in Natasha’s arms and sat up fully to gaze across at Agatha.

Her head was spinning and she felt hollowed out. But she recognised the tension in the room. Saw the anger on Agatha’s face.

“What’s happened?”

Agatha’s jaw flexed but she shook her head just once and forced herself to soften for Rio’s sake even as the still frowning woman began to move fully from the bed to get to Agatha.

Natasha didn’t move, just watched the interaction closely, remaining seated against the headboard.

“Agatha,” Rio whispered softly, reached to turn the woman to look at her and already feeling a little faint, her body still exhausted.

“It’s fine. We were just-…”

“I was just asking Agatha why Alice is still alive.”

Rio closed her eyes and rubbed at her temple, “Natasha, we’ve discussed this.”

“Ella es mala para ti.” She’s bad for you.

Rio turned to look at her best friend and shook her head slowly, watching as Natasha raised a brow in challenge, demanding a rebuttal.

“I can guess what that means,” Agatha muttered under her breath, her hand instinctively unfurling from its tight fist so she could reach for Rio.

“Nat. Can you try to be nice, please. Agatha has done everything-…”

“I’ve had enough of this,” the red head said, her voice still the infuriating mix of low, deep, and flat.

She stood from the bed and avoided Rio as she reached for her, storming from the room and leaving the other two in her wake.

“Natasha.”

Rio charged after her, Agatha close behind and holding her arm back to try and keep Rio out of harm’s way, knowing whatever was about to happen wouldn’t be pretty.

“Rio. Don’t.”

But Agatha was curious to see what would happen. Because her love for Alice had held her back even a little bit. Her love for Rio even more so.

But Natasha. Agatha had no idea how much her love for Rio would temper her anger.

And a small part of her, the furious, uncompromising piece of her that still wanted to strangle Alice for laying a finger on Rio, wanted to see what Natasha would do.

By the time they rounded the corner into the living room Agatha, and Rio, saw exactly what she’d do.

They saw Natasha grabbing Alice by her collar and pulling her to her feet.

“Alice?” She asked, but knew the answer already, throwing Alice at the wall like she was a rag doll and thrusting her forearm up against her throat to hold her there.

Alice attempted a slight struggle but was still in the throes of her trip, a little woozy, and puffy, exhausted from all the crying.

And Natasha had moved like a thief in the night.

“Oh my god! Oh my god! Oh my god!” Jen was on her feet, flailing. But she didn’t try to grab Natasha and looked instead to Agatha and Rio with wide eyes: “Do something!”

Rio was shouting for Natasha to stop and struggling against Agatha’s now firm hold, Agatha having decided that whatever hurt Rio would get from her holding her would be better than whatever might come of the violent performance in front of them.

But soon Alice looked on the verge of collapse and Agatha pulled Rio back to step around her and grab Natasha.

Growling as she tugged Natasha back by her arms, she held her in a vicelike grip.

But it wasn’t necessary.

Natasha didn’t struggle.

She barely reacted to being pulled away, having expected it at some point, having done just what she meant to and no more.

She allowed her arms to be pulled behind her and allowed Rio to crowd her from the front, grasping her shirt and shouting in her face, “What the fuck! What the fuck, Nat! I told you! I told you it was sorted! You promised!”

Green eyes flashed up to meet familiar brown and saw in them a wildness that she’d only seen a few times before. For the first time that night, at least in front of more than just Rio, Natasha let her guard down and she turned her head slightly, leaning as much as she could in Agatha’s hold so their cheeks brushed and she could turn her head to let her lips graze Rio’s cheek in a quiet, personal act of contrition.

Natasha’s lips against her cheek awoke something in Rio that calmed the raging beast within her.

Natasha was her Alice. Natasha had done what Alice had done two nights ago. And for that reason she couldn’t be angry at her. Not truly.

Her shoulders slumped a little and she dropped her gaze to where Agatha was holding her best friend steady, though Natasha still didn’t pull against her, only stood still, watching Rio closely.

Alice had slid slowly down the wall, crumbling in on herself on the floor as she battled to catch her breath, clutching at her throat as Jen ran to her side.

The movement made Natasha look away again, set her jaw again, her gaze moving from Rio and down to the woman now curled in on herself on the floor. She barely reacted to the sight, not in the way she’d reacted to Rio. Agatha kept a hold of her.

“She deserves worse.”

“Natasha,” Rio groaned, moving her hand up to turn her face towards her again and brushing her thumbs across her cheeks, her volume now normal and her tone desperate, “Natasha. You said you wouldn’t.”

“I said I wouldn’t kill her. I didn’t say anything about scaring her.”

“That was more than scaring her you psychotic bitch!”

Rio glanced aside and saw Jen move up to them, looking insane with rage and Rio instinctively moved to cover Natasha even as Agatha dropped her hold on the woman and moved quickly to begin pulling Rio away.

“Don’t, don’t,” Rio said quickly, quietly, to Agatha, but Agatha didn’t let up and kept her hold on Rio, trying to pull her away from danger as she watched Jen tower over Natasha and the smaller woman square up to her.

Agatha’s hands were insistent and she pulled Rio a couple steps back.

“Do you think you’re some sort of vigilante or something?! Touch her again and I will kill you!”

Natasha scoffed and tilted her head, “With your crystals or your super serums?”

“Natasha.”

Rio stuggled a little more in Agatha’s hold but Agatha held firm and squeezed Rio’s waist where she held her, “Honey.”

Alice, from the floor, spluttering slightly, spoke up just as Jen stepped towards the woman who’d attacked her wife.

“Jen, it’s fine. Jen. I…”

“She deserves it,” Natasha finished for her, giving Jen a final once over and reading it correctly that she wouldn’t go for her.

She then turned back to Alice, “Go near her again and I won’t let up.”

“Natasha,” Rio pleaded, reaching for her and just about making contact with her shoulder to tug at her as Agatha refused to let go of her. “Nat, it’s too much.”

Natasha nodded just once as she met Rio’s eye again and glanced behind her to meet Agatha’s steely gaze.

But she spoke to Rio and Rio alone: “You should come home with me.”

Agatha’s jaw flexed and she raised her chin, her hold on Rio slackening a little but she didn’t say anything.

She knew if she did she wouldn’t be able to stop herself from ripping into the redhead. So she bit down on her tongue and refused to look away.

Rio sighed and pushed Agatha’s arms away, finally breaking from her hold as she crowded Natasha again and began ushering her out the door, glancing briefly back to check on Alice and giving Agatha a quick, what she hoped was, reassuring look.

“I’m sorry,” she said to the room, leaving behind a panting Alice and a shell shocked Jen.

But Agatha was already moving and by the time Rio had hurried Natasha into the bedroom, Agatha was right behind them, looking furious.

“Don’t,” Rio warned quickly, turning to see Agatha open her mouth as if to speak, but knowing she was about to shout.

But she wasn’t annoyed that Agatha had followed. It was just what it was. An inevitability.

Agatha leant back against the door, her eyes following Rio as she moved towards her best friend. Her teeth still pin wring her tongue, threatening to spill blood, but refusing to relinquish their hold.

“You shouldn’t have done that. I’d handled it. I’m fine.”

“Far from it.”

“Natasha.”

“Tell me that Rio a year ago would have allowed someone to break her ribs.”

“It’s different. This is so different. She did it because-…”

“Because of her.”

Rio stiffened and for the first time in her life, for the first time in almost twenty years, she wanted to slap Natasha.

She took a slow, steadying breath and felt her chest sting with the weight of it before she took a slow step towards her and felt Agatha mirror this movement behind her.

“It was a misunderstanding.”

“You’re not safe with her. And you never will be.”

Green eyes flashed then and Rio’s breath hitched: both reacting to the same stimuli. Agatha had wrapped her arm around Rio. But it wasn’t her usual hold, protective and firm. She held her loosely, almost as if her arm had ended up there by accident.

Rio’s body tensed, prepared for Agatha to shout or to fight Natasha. But she didn’t. She heard her take a slow breath and saw Natasha’s brow furrow just slightly as she watched the woman now directly behind Rio.

And the voice that spoke then, the voice that could make Rio shiver or make her feel safe, or both, suddenly made her want to cry.

“You should go home with her.”

Rio turned in Agatha’s hold and stared at her in disbelief, “What? That’s… I’m leaving with you tomorrow.”

“No,” Agatha’s voice was firm again but her eyes looked glassy, like she was fighting against something and losing the battle, “No you should go with her. You need to rest and I’ll deal with those two. Staying here will… it won’t help anything.”

“Finally we agree on something, Harkness.”

“It’s been a long weekend and you’re not,” Agatha began but took a sharp inhale in as Rio shook her head and pulled away from her, “You need some time to recover. To think.”

“Think?”

“Yes,” Agatha continued slowly, suddenly unsure of herself, “But I want you to move in with me.”

Rio opened her mouth to speak but couldn’t find the words and instead took another step back even as Agatha moved in to hold her, “I want you to move in with me desperately.”

A touch to her lower back let Rio know that Natasha was there, wanting to leave, but all she could focus on were deep blue eyes that bored through her, and the soft hold of Agatha over her jaw.

“No. No. I don’t need to think about it.”

She was practically sandwiched between the two women she loved most in the world. The only two women she’d ever truly loved and instead of feeling comforted, she felt sick.

“Rio,” Agatha breathed out quietly, her fingers moving back to slip into Rio’s hair, holding her steady and moving in closer.

Rio could feel Agatha’s breath against her lips and she clutched at the front of her shirt, tugging at her gently, desperate for her to take it back.

“Take a couple days. Then come to D.C.”

“Agatha,” Rio insisted, frowning as she kissed her once, twice, three times, unsure why this was suddenly happening. Why Agatha wanted her far from her when the past two days she’d done nothing but be close.

“I love you. Be with Natasha for a couple days. Take as long as you need and then… come to me.”

Rio frowned still, her tired mind struggling to keep up with this new plan. But Natasha was behind her, now moving her hand to her waist and tugging her backwards, trying to manoeuvre her away.

“Wait,” Rio protested quietly, glancing around her at Natasha for a second before turning back to Agatha. “You haven’t changed your mind?”

“Never.”

Rio hesitated then, knowing that Agatha wouldn’t be doing this without reason but she couldn’t figure out what it was, not with her mind still blurry and her body torn between exhaustion, anger, and pain.

“Okay,” she finally breathed out, watching the way Agatha’s lashes fluttered and she dropped her gaze to Rio’s lips.

Natasha’s touch became firmer and so Rio only let herself press a gentle kiss to Agatha, lingering for a while before she pulled away.

She moved then to the door with Natasha close to her side and paused to look around, catching Agatha’s gaze for just a second and seeing it drift from her own to the woman beside her.

Agatha’s jaw flexed a little when it did, and Rio could have sworn she saw her nod once but Natasha was ushering her out the door before she could think much of it.

They disappeared from the room, from the apartment, and out into the cold afternoon in New York.

Exhausted both mentally and physically, Rio couldn’t quite understand what had happened and why Agatha was telling her to take some time to think.

But Natasha was leading them home, holding her hand firmly, and not letting go until Rio was inside her apartment and tucked under her own blankets.

Natasha stayed with her as she slept, neither having spoken since leaving Agatha’s.

Rio slept soundly until the next morning, and woke reluctantly, slowly, blinking into the mid-morning sun. She reached out instinctively and found a soft body beside her that was familiar and welcome, but not the one she was looking for.

“Was it a dream?”

“Which part?”

“All of it.”

Natasha shifted where she lay on her side next to Rio and frowned a little, “Agatha’s called twice this morning. I think you’ll find she’s text you. Your phone’s been lighting up since we got back.”

“She called you?”

“Twice.”

Rio swallowed thickly and nodded, moving her hand to twist against Natasha’s shirt, “I’m going to call her and then we need to talk about it. What you did yesterday.”

“I know.”

Her best friend smiled a little at her, gentle fingers flexing over Rio’s tired ones and not for the first time Rio wondered what she’d do without Natasha. Until she met Agatha she’d been her sole protector. Her family.

She sighed and rolled away, wincing as she reached for her phone that Natasha had plugged in to charge over night.

“Take your meds first.”

Rio hummed and allowed the kiss to her shoulder as she reached for her meds and took them with the help of a sip of water.

She heard the telltale signs of running water and the churn of her old boiler switching the heat on and knew Natasha was giving her some privacy to call her girlfriend.

Natasha was right. Agatha had text. As had Alice.

11:07pm
Agatha Harkness: Can you let me know you’re okay?

12:33am
Agatha Harkness: I’m assuming you’re asleep. I love you. I’ll call in the morning.

02:29am
Alice Wu-Gulliver: I’m so sorry. Can you call me later?

05:37am
Agatha Harkness: I’m on my way home. Call me when you can.

10:12am
Agatha Harkness: I’ve spoken to Natasha. Call me when you can.

She had three missed calls from Agatha.

She picked up immediately.

“Rio. Are you okay?”

“Why did you change your mind?”

There was silence down the line and Rio began to toy with her sleep shorts, staring at an umbrella plant she’d had for years, counting the seconds until Agatha spoke again.

“I didn’t. I want you to move in. But I don’t want your moving in with me to make Natasha hate me forever.”

“What did she say to you?”

“She’s your family, Rio. You wouldn’t be happy if she didn’t approve.”

“She already doesn’t.”

“I know. And maybe that won’t change but… she was right. In the space of two days where you’d been through so much, too much, you changed your whole life. For me. And I want to make sure that-…”

She hadn’t built her empire without a few, necessary sacrifices along the way.

“Stay with Natasha. Talk to her. Talk it through. I’ll be here. Call me whenever you want. I love you and I want you here with me.”

“Call me,” Agatha requested softly, though Rio had just promised she would, and Rio nodded into the phone before she hung up.

“Coffee. Coffee and food. You need to look after yourself.”

Rio sighed and rubbed at her eyes, turning slowly to look at the other person who loved her most in the world and nodded.

“Only if it’s-…”

“Bacon, egg, and cheese on poppy from Santaigo’s. Yeah, yeah.”

“What else?”

“I don’t trust her with you.”

“And?”

“And yet here you are, broken and bruised.”

“That’s not fair. Alice did to me exactly what you did to her. She did it for Agatha. And you did it for me.”

“She took me by surprise. I told you.”

Natasha stretched her arm over the back of the couch and settled back more, “You’re changing too much for her. Making too many allowances. Excuses.”

“We both knew the day might come where I’d have to quit. You hate my job anyway.”

“I hate it because I have to worry about you all the time. I have to think about those lousy women with their hands on you.”

“Then what is the problem?”

Natasha’s face was impassive still, but Rio felt her fingers twitch against her leg and so she let her sit in it for a second, knowing she needed a minute.

“I won’t. I love her. And I love you. That will never change.”
